15 Usage of crackfortran:
16 ======================
17 Command line keys: -quiet,-verbose,-fix,-f77,-f90,-show,-h <pyffilename>
18 -m <module name for f77 routines>,--ignore-contains
19 Functions: crackfortran, crack2fortran
20 The following Fortran statements/constructions are supported
21 (or will be if needed):
22 block data,byte,call,character,common,complex,contains,data,
23 dimension,double complex,double precision,end,external,function,
24 implicit,integer,intent,interface,intrinsic,
25 logical,module,optional,parameter,private,public,
26 program,real,(sequence?),subroutine,type,use,virtual,
27 include,pythonmodule
28 Note: 'virtual' is mapped to 'dimension'.
  • E501 Line too long (85 > 79 characters)
29 Note: 'implicit integer (z) static (z)' is 'implicit static (z)' (this is minor bug).
30 Note: code after 'contains' will be ignored until its scope ends.
  • E501 Line too long (82 > 79 characters)
31 Note: 'common' statement is extended: dimensions are moved to variable definitions
32 Note: f2py directive: <commentchar>f2py<line> is read as <line>
33 Note: pythonmodule is introduced to represent Python module
34  
35 Usage:
36 `postlist=crackfortran(files)`
  • E501 Line too long (82 > 79 characters)
37 `postlist` contains declaration information read from the list of files `files`.
38 `crack2fortran(postlist)` returns a fortran code to be saved to pyf-file
39  
40 `postlist` has the following structure:
41 *** it is a list of dictionaries containing `blocks':
  • E501 Line too long (80 > 79 characters)
42 B = {'block','body','vars','parent_block'[,'name','prefix','args','result',
43 'implicit','externals','interfaced','common','sortvars',
44 'commonvars','note']}
45 B['block'] = 'interface' | 'function' | 'subroutine' | 'module' |
46 'program' | 'block data' | 'type' | 'pythonmodule' |
47 'abstract interface'
  • E501 Line too long (82 > 79 characters)
48 B['body'] --- list containing `subblocks' with the same structure as `blocks'
49 B['parent_block'] --- dictionary of a parent block:
50 C['body'][<index>]['parent_block'] is C
51 B['vars'] --- dictionary of variable definitions
  • E501 Line too long (98 > 79 characters)
52 B['sortvars'] --- dictionary of variable definitions sorted by dependence (independent first)
53 B['name'] --- name of the block (not if B['block']=='interface')
54 B['prefix'] --- prefix string (only if B['block']=='function')
  • E501 Line too long (83 > 79 characters)
55 B['args'] --- list of argument names if B['block']== 'function' | 'subroutine'
56 B['result'] --- name of the return value (only if B['block']=='function')
57 B['implicit'] --- dictionary {'a':<variable definition>,'b':...} | None
58 B['externals'] --- list of variables being external
59 B['interfaced'] --- list of variables being external and defined
60 B['common'] --- dictionary of common blocks (list of objects)
  • E501 Line too long (111 > 79 characters)
61 B['commonvars'] --- list of variables used in common blocks (dimensions are moved to variable definitions)
62 B['from'] --- string showing the 'parents' of the current block
63 B['use'] --- dictionary of modules used in current block:
64 {<modulename>:{['only':<0|1>],['map':{<local_name1>:<use_name1>,...}]}}
65 B['note'] --- list of LaTeX comments on the block
66 B['f2pyenhancements'] --- optional dictionary
67 {'threadsafe':'','fortranname':<name>,
68 'callstatement':<C-expr>|<multi-line block>,
69 'callprotoargument':<C-expr-list>,
70 'usercode':<multi-line block>|<list of multi-line blocks>,
71 'pymethoddef:<multi-line block>'
72 }
73 B['entry'] --- dictionary {entryname:argslist,..}
74 B['varnames'] --- list of variable names given in the order of reading the
75 Fortran code, useful for derived types.
  • E501 Line too long (95 > 79 characters)

79 {'typespec'[,'attrspec','kindselector','charselector','=','typename']}
80 D['typespec'] = 'byte' | 'character' | 'complex' | 'double complex' |
  • E501 Line too long (81 > 79 characters)
81 'double precision' | 'integer' | 'logical' | 'real' | 'type'
82 D['attrspec'] --- list of attributes (e.g. 'dimension(<arrayspec>)',
83 'external','intent(in|out|inout|hide|c|callback|cache|aligned4|aligned8|aligned16)',
84 'optional','required', etc)
85 K = D['kindselector'] = {['*','kind']} (only if D['typespec'] =
86 'complex' | 'integer' | 'logical' | 'real' )

89 D['='] --- initialization expression string

  • E501 Line too long (80 > 79 characters)

  • E501 Line too long (86 > 79 characters)
94 D['check'] --- list of C-expressions; if C-expr returns zero, exception is raised
95 D['note'] --- list of LaTeX comments on the variable
96 *** Meaning of kind/char selectors (few examples):
97 D['typespec>']*K['*']
98 D['typespec'](kind=K['kind'])

100 character(len=C['len'],kind=C['kind'])
101 (see also fortran type declaration statement formats below)
102  
103 Fortran 90 type declaration statement format (F77 is subset of F90)
104 ====================================================================
105 (Main source: IBM XL Fortran 5.1 Language Reference Manual)
106 type declaration = <typespec> [[<attrspec>]::] <entitydecl>
107 <typespec> = byte |
108 character[<charselector>] |
109 complex[<kindselector>] |
110 double complex |
111 double precision |
112 integer[<kindselector>] |
113 logical[<kindselector>] |
114 real[<kindselector>] |
115 type(<typename>)
116 <charselector> = * <charlen> |
117 ([len=]<len>[,[kind=]<kind>]) |
118 (kind=<kind>[,len=<len>])
119 <kindselector> = * <intlen> |
120 ([kind=]<kind>)
121 <attrspec> = comma separated list of attributes.
122 Only the following attributes are used in
123 building up the interface:
124 external
125 (parameter --- affects '=' key)
126 optional
127 intent
128 Other attributes are ignored.
129 <intentspec> = in | out | inout
130 <arrayspec> = comma separated list of dimension bounds.
131 <entitydecl> = <name> [[*<charlen>][(<arrayspec>)] | [(<arrayspec>)]*<charlen>]
132 [/<init_expr>/ | =<init_expr>] [,<entitydecl>]
133  
134 In addition, the following attributes are used: check,depend,note
135  
136 TODO:
137 * Apply 'parameter' attribute (e.g. 'integer parameter :: i=2' 'real x(i)'
138 -> 'real x(2)')
  • E501 Line too long (86 > 79 characters)
139 The above may be solved by creating appropriate preprocessor program, for example.

287 def getextension(name):
288 i = name.rfind('.')
289 if i == -1:
290 return ''
291 if '\\' in name[i:]:
292 return ''
293 if '/' in name[i:]:
294 return ''
295 return name[i + 1:]

305 """Check if file is in free format Fortran."""

307 # signs of free format are detected.

  • E501 Line too long (89 > 79 characters)

321 result = 1
322 break
323 line = f.readline()
324 return result

625 def split_by_unquoted(line, characters):
626 """
627 Splits the line into (line[:i], line[i:]),
628 where i is the index of first occurrence of one of the characters

630 """
  • E501 Line too long (80 > 79 characters)
631 assert not (set('"\'') & set(characters)), "cannot split by unquoted quotes"
632 r = re.compile(
633 r"\A(?P<before>({single_quoted}|{double_quoted}|{not_quoted})*)"
634 r"(?P<after>{char}.*)\Z".format(
635 not_quoted="[^\"'{}]".format(re.escape(characters)),
636 char="[{}]".format(re.escape(characters)),
637 single_quoted=r"('([^'\\]|(\\.))*')",
638 double_quoted=r'("([^"\\]|(\\.))*")'))
639 m = r.match(line)

641 d = m.groupdict()
642 return (d["before"], d["after"])
643 return (line, "")

1513 def removespaces(expr):
1514 expr = expr.strip()
1515 if len(expr) <= 1:
1516 return expr
1517 expr2 = expr[0]
1518 for i in range(1, len(expr) - 1):
1519 if (expr[i] == ' ' and
1520 ((expr[i + 1] in "()[]{}=+-/* ") or
1521 (expr[i - 1] in "()[]{}=+-/* "))):
1522 continue
1523 expr2 = expr2 + expr[i]
1524 expr2 = expr2 + expr[-1]
1525 return expr2

1528 def markinnerspaces(line):
1529 """
  • W291 Trailing whitespace
1530 The function replace all spaces in the input variable line which are
1531 surrounded with quotation marks, with the triplet "@_@".
1532  
1533 For instance, for the input "a 'b c'" the function returns "a 'b@_@c'"
1534  
1535 Parameters
1536 ----------
1537 line : str
1538  
1539 Returns
1540 -------
1541 str
1542  
  • W291 Trailing whitespace
1543 """

1546 current_quote = None
1547 escaped = ''

1549 if escaped == '\\' and c in ['\\', '\'', '"']:
1550 fragment += c

1552 continue

1556 inside = not inside

1561 escaped = c # reset to non-backslash
1562 return fragment
